DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study was to compare two methods for neuromuscular monitoring, acceleromyography and mechanomyography for establishing the dose-response relationship and the potency of a neuromuscular blocking agent using rocuronium as an example. We hypothesized that there would be no significant difference between potencies estimated using acceleromyography and mechanomyography.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Acceleromyography (AMG) and Mechanomyography (MMG) for Establishing Potency of Neuromuscular Blocking Agents
DOC.criteria: ASA IIII Ideal weight +/20% Both arms available for neuromuscular monitoring Surgery in supine position Participated surgery time more than 30 min Pregnant and breastfeeding women Patients with known illness or use of medications known to influence the neuromuscular transmission Known significant renal or hepatic dysfunction Allergy to medications used in the study
